verbs.description: President Trump [V: has] railed against NFL players who took a knee during the playing of the national anthem as unpatriotic over the last two years while ignoring the stated reasons for the protests but that changed a bit on Friday .

[ARG0: President Trump] has [V: railed] [ARG1: against NFL players who took a knee during the playing of the national anthem as unpatriotic over the last two years while ignoring the stated reasons for the protests] but that changed a bit on Friday .

President Trump has railed against [ARG0: NFL players] [R-ARG0: who] [V: took] [ARG1: a knee] [ARGM-TMP: during the playing of the national anthem] [ARGM-PRD: as unpatriotic] [ARGM-TMP: over the last two years] [ARGM-TMP: while ignoring the stated reasons for the protests] but that changed a bit on Friday .

President Trump has railed against NFL players [ARG0: who] took a knee during the playing of the national anthem as unpatriotic over the last two years while [V: ignoring] [ARG1: the stated reasons for the protests] but that changed a bit on Friday .

President Trump has railed against NFL players who took a knee during the playing of the national anthem as unpatriotic over the last two years while ignoring the stated reasons for the protests but [ARG1: that] [V: changed] [ARGM-EXT: a bit] [ARGM-TMP: on Friday] .
